title: How to Store Urine for a Drug Test

steps.title: Get a sample as close to the day and time of your test as possible.
steps.content: Get a sample as close to the day and time of your test as possible. Castro recommends leaving as little time as possible between when you collect your urine sample and your drug test. Urine starts to decompose and break down into ammonia as soon as it leaves the body, turning it darker, smellier, and more acidic. [1] X Research source The longer the urine sits around, the less plausible it may be to use for a drug test . To seem the most plausible, urine should be fresh and warm. To collect a sterile urine sample , Tobis recommends a "mid-stream clean catch:" For males: “Clean the head of the penis with a safe antiseptic towelette or soap and water. Let the first portion of the urine stream go into the toilet, then use a sterile urine cup to catch the urine in the middle of the stream.” For females: “Clean the labia with a safe antiseptic towelette or soap and water. Spread the labia and discard the first portion of the [urine] stream into the toilet. Then, place a urine cup in the middle of the stream.”

steps.title: Store urine in a resealable plastic or glass container.
steps.content: Store urine in a resealable plastic or glass container. Most often, the test administrator will give you a sterile container to use for urine collection and storage. [2] X Research source If you don’t have one, use a plastic or glass container and boil it for 10 minutes to sterilize it. [3] X Research source Make sure the container is airtight, so that no pee will spill out. Castro recommends using a plastic container for short-term storage, or a glass container for long-term storage, as plastic can leech other chemicals into the urine. You can also put the container in a resealable plastic bag for an extra layer of protection. If you plan to store the urine long-term, label it with the date you collected the sample. Keep in mind that glass can break if you freeze it or warm it up too fast. The administrator of the drug test may give you a container to collect a simple in.

steps.title: Keep urine warm in the short term with hand warmers.
steps.content: Keep urine warm in the short term with hand warmers. If you plan to use a urine sample within the hour, store it in a small, airtight bottle, such as a pill bottle. Keep it warm with a hand warmer . Right before you take the test, remove the hand warmer and let the urine come back down to your body temperature (around 98.6°F or 37°C). [4] X Trustworthy Source MedlinePlus Collection of medical information sourced from the US National Library of Medicine Go to source Use a rubber band to secure the hand warmer around the bottle.

steps.title: Refrigerate urine as soon as possible if you plan to use it in more than 1 hour.
steps.content: Refrigerate urine as soon as possible if you plan to use it in more than 1 hour. The sooner you can refrigerate pee, the more viable the sample will be. It's best to refrigerate it as soon as you get the sample, but within 30 minutes will do. [5] X Trustworthy Source Johns Hopkins Medicine Official resource database of the world-leading Johns Hopkins Hospital Go to source Use or freeze refrigerated urine within 1 day. Do not freeze your urine sample for longer term storage.

steps.title: Freeze a urine sample if you plan to use it within 4 months.
steps.content: Freeze a urine sample if you plan to use it within 4 months. If you don't plan to use your urine sample within 24 hours, it's best to freeze it. Keep the urine in an airtight container and use it within 4 months. [6] X Research source Urine samples that show evidence of repeated freezing and thawing may not be accepted for analysis, so plan to only freeze your sample once. Sources differ on how long you can freeze urine and still use it. As a rule of thumb, the sooner you can use it, the better. Be sure that you are freezing clean pee. Freezing pee that contains THC will increase the concentration.

steps.title: Let urine thaw at room temperature overnight if frozen.
steps.content: Let urine thaw at room temperature overnight if frozen. All frozen urine must thaw before processing. [7] X Research source The best way to bring a urine sample to room temperature is by letting it defrost naturally. Microwaving urine could potentially damage the sample and make it unusable. Make sure you use the sample within the day when you defrost it.

steps.title: Use a heating pad, microwave, or hand warmers to bring the pee temperature up.
steps.content: Use a heating pad, microwave, or hand warmers to bring the pee temperature up. Once the urine has reached room temperature, the next step is getting it up to body temperature, or even slightly higher since urine samples for drug tests must be 90 to 100 °F (32 to 38 °C). [8] X Research source Wrap the bottle in a heating pad or hand warmer, or place it in the microwave for 10 seconds. If you use the microwave technique, it's a good idea to use a hand warmer to keep the sample warm while you are transporting it. It's best to heat the sample to slightly above body temperature, as it will cool down in the time it takes for you to get to the test. The average normal body temperature is 98.6°F (37°C). [9] X Trustworthy Source MedlinePlus Collection of medical information sourced from the US National Library of Medicine Go to source

steps.title: Keep the sample close to your body before using it.
steps.content: Keep the sample close to your body before using it. Keeping the sample against your body will preserve the temperature. It should be as close to your body temperature as possible. Acceptable temperature ranges for urine samples are between 90 to 100 °F (32 to 38 °C). [10] X Research source Try to keep the sample around your lower body, like in a bag between your thighs.
